intro: Crucianella parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered crucianella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is a shrub native to parts of South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, woody fruits that contain one or two seeds. Crucianella parviflora is typically found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or well-drained soils.
